revision.text:
{{Infobox battle item |name = Parc Safari |image = [[File:safarizone1.png]] |caption = Le joueur dans le Parc Safari. |location = Kanto }} Le '''Parc Safari''' est une région de [[Kanto]] où le joueur peut dépenser 100 [[Quest Points|Points de Quêtes]] {{Questpoints}} pour tenter d'attraper des pokémons unique à la région. Certains de ces pokémon, à l'instar des jeux originaux, n'apparaissent que dans le Parc Safari. À l'entrée du Parc, le joueur reçoit 30 Safari balls. Lors d'un combat, il peut choisir entre attraper, lancer un caillou, lancer un appât ou fuir. Pour débloquer cette zone le joueur doit tout d'abord récupérer le [[Safari Ticket|Pass Safari]]. Les Pokémons non-attrapés ont deux fois plus de chances d'apparaitre qu'à la normal. Le joueur peut sortir et entrer du Parc Safari à volonté sans devoir payer les 100 {{Questpoints}} à chaque fois. La seule raison de repayer les frais d'entrée est si le joueur n'a plus de Safari balls ==Pokémon== {| class="wikitable sortable" style |- ! Pokémon !! Taux de rencontre |- | [[File:Nidoran(F).png|40px]] Nidoran(F)|| 9.04% |- | [[File:Nidorina.png|40px]] Nidorina || 6.02% |- | [[File:Nidoran(M).png|40px]] Nidoran(M) || 15.06% |- | [[File:Nidorino.png|40px]] Nidorino || 6.02% |- | [[File:Exeggcute.png|40px]] Noeunoeuf || 12.05% |- | [[File:Paras.png|40px]] Paras || 3.01% |- | [[File:Parasect.png|40px]] Parasect || 9.04% |- | [[File:Rhyhorn.png|40px]] Rhinocorne || 6.02% |- | [[File:Chansey.png|40px]] Leveinard || 2.41% |- | [[File:Scyther.png|40px]] Insécateur || 2.41% |- | [[File:Pinsir.png|40px]] Scarabrute || 2.41% |- | [[File:Kangaskhan.png|40px]] Kangourex || 9.04% |- | [[File:Tauros.png|40px]] Tauros || 6.02% |- | [[File:Cubone.png|40px]] Osselait || 6.02% |- | [[File:Marowak.png|40px]] Ossatueur || 3.01% |- | [[File:Tangela.png|40px]] Saquedeneu|| 2.41% |}
==Actions== {| class="wikitable" ! Action !! Effect |- | Ball || Attempt to catch the Pokémon with a Safari Ball. Based on catch chance, this action may fail, after which the Pokémon might flee (based on escape chance), watch carefully / be angry (i.e. do nothing), or resume eating bait. Upon running out of Safari Balls, the player will be forced out of the Safari Zone, requiring them to pay the entrance fee again to re-enter. |- | Rock || Toss a rock at the Pokémon, removing "eating" status and making it angry for 2 - 7 turns. When angry, a Pokémon's catch chance and escape chance are both doubled. |- | Run || Flee the encounter and return to the Safari Zone overworld without penalty. |- | colspan=2 | All three types of bait give the Pokémon "eating" status, and removes "angry" status. While eating, a Pokémon's catch chance is halved, and its escape chance is quartered. Pokémon begin encounters with an escape chance of 30%. |- | Bait (generic) || Gives the Pokémon "eating" status for 2 - 7 turns. No other effects. |- | Bait ([[Razz]] [[Berry]]) || Gives the Pokémon "eating" status for 2 - 8 turns. Divides escape chance by 1.5 for the rest of the encounter unless another type of bait is used. |- | Bait ([[Nanab]] [[Berry]]) || Gives the Pokémon "eating" status for 2 - 8 turns. Boosts catch chance by 1.5x for the rest of the encounter unless another type of bait is used. |}
Exemple d'utilisation des appâts : * Vous rencontrez un Parasect sauvage dans le Parc Safari. Vous avez '''12,5%''' de chance de le capturer, et il a '''30%''' de chance de fuir. * Au tour du joueur, vous utilisez une [[Nanab Berry|Baie Nanab]] en appât. Vous multipliez vos chance de l'attraper par 1,5 : 12,5 * 1,5 = '''18,75%'''. Ses chances de fuir restent à '''30%'''. * Le Parasect mange. La chance de l'attraper diminue de moitié : 18,75 / 2 = '''9,375%'''. Sa chance de fuir elle est divisée par 4 : 30 / 4 = '''7,5%'''. * Après quelques tours, le Parasect a fini de manger. Les bonus liés à l'état sont inversés, mais le bonus de la [[Nanab Berry|Baie Nanab]] persiste : la chance de l'attraper est de '''18,75%''', et sa chance de fuir set revenue à '''30%'''.
revision.comment: Created page with "Exemple d'utilisation des appâts : * Vous rencontrez un Parasect sauvage dans le Parc Safari. Vous avez '''12,5%''' de chance de le capturer, et il a '''30%''' de chance de fuir. * Au tour du joueur, vous utilisez une [[Nanab Berry|Baie Nanab]] en appât. Vous multipliez vos chance de l'attraper par 1,5 : 12,5 * 1,5 = '''18,75%'''. Ses chances de fuir restent à '''30%'''. * Le Parasect mange. La chance de l'attraper diminue de moitié : 18,75 / 2 = '''9,375%'''. Sa ch..."

revision.text:
{{Infobox battle item |name = Parc Safari |image = [[File:safarizone1.png]] |caption = Le joueur dans le Parc Safari. |location = Kanto }} Le '''Parc Safari''' est une région de [[Kanto]] où le joueur peut dépenser 100 [[Quest Points|Points de Quêtes]] {{Questpoints}} pour tenter d'attraper des pokémons unique à la région. Certains de ces pokémon, à l'instar des jeux originaux, n'apparaissent que dans le Parc Safari. À l'entrée du Parc, le joueur reçoit 30 Safari balls. Lors d'un combat, il peut choisir entre attraper, lancer un caillou, lancer un appât ou fuir. Pour débloquer cette zone le joueur doit tout d'abord récupérer le [[Safari Ticket|Pass Safari]]. Les Pokémons non-attrapés ont deux fois plus de chances d'apparaitre qu'à la normal. Le joueur peut sortir et entrer du Parc Safari à volonté sans devoir payer les 100 {{Questpoints}} à chaque fois. La seule raison de repayer les frais d'entrée est si le joueur n'a plus de Safari balls ==Pokémon== {| class="wikitable sortable" style |- ! Pokémon !! Taux de rencontre |- | [[File:Nidoran(F).png|40px]] Nidoran(F)|| 9.04% |- | [[File:Nidorina.png|40px]] Nidorina || 6.02% |- | [[File:Nidoran(M).png|40px]] Nidoran(M) || 15.06% |- | [[File:Nidorino.png|40px]] Nidorino || 6.02% |- | [[File:Exeggcute.png|40px]] Noeunoeuf || 12.05% |- | [[File:Paras.png|40px]] Paras || 3.01% |- | [[File:Parasect.png|40px]] Parasect || 9.04% |- | [[File:Rhyhorn.png|40px]] Rhinocorne || 6.02% |- | [[File:Chansey.png|40px]] Leveinard || 2.41% |- | [[File:Scyther.png|40px]] Insécateur || 2.41% |- | [[File:Pinsir.png|40px]] Scarabrute || 2.41% |- | [[File:Kangaskhan.png|40px]] Kangourex || 9.04% |- | [[File:Tauros.png|40px]] Tauros || 6.02% |- | [[File:Cubone.png|40px]] Osselait || 6.02% |- | [[File:Marowak.png|40px]] Ossatueur || 3.01% |- | [[File:Tangela.png|40px]] Saquedeneu|| 2.41% |}
==Actions== {| class="wikitable" ! Action !! Effect |- | Ball || Attempt to catch the Pokémon with a Safari Ball. Based on catch chance, this action may fail, after which the Pokémon might flee (based on escape chance), watch carefully / be angry (i.e. do nothing), or resume eating bait. Upon running out of Safari Balls, the player will be forced out of the Safari Zone, requiring them to pay the entrance fee again to re-enter. |- | Rock || Toss a rock at the Pokémon, removing "eating" status and making it angry for 2 - 7 turns. When angry, a Pokémon's catch chance and escape chance are both doubled. |- | Run || Flee the encounter and return to the Safari Zone overworld without penalty. |- | colspan=2 | All three types of bait give the Pokémon "eating" status, and removes "angry" status. While eating, a Pokémon's catch chance is halved, and its escape chance is quartered. Pokémon begin encounters with an escape chance of 30%. |- | Bait (generic) || Gives the Pokémon "eating" status for 2 - 7 turns. No other effects. |- | Bait ([[Razz]] [[Berry]]) || Gives the Pokémon "eating" status for 2 - 8 turns. Divides escape chance by 1.5 for the rest of the encounter unless another type of bait is used. |- | Bait ([[Nanab]] [[Berry]]) || Gives the Pokémon "eating" status for 2 - 8 turns. Boosts catch chance by 1.5x for the rest of the encounter unless another type of bait is used. |}
Bait usage example * Parasect encountered in the Safari Zone. Catch chance is '''12.5%''', escape chance is '''30%'''. * Player's turn, Nanab Berry bait used. Catch chance boosted by 1.5x: 12.5 * 1.5 = '''18.75%'''. Escape chance is '''30%'''. * Parasect is eating. Catch chance halved: 18.75 / 2 = '''9.375%'''. Escape chance quartered: 30 / 4 = '''7.5%'''. * A few turns pass, and Parasect finishes eating. Eating bonuses are reverted, but Nanab bonus persists. Catch chance is '''18.75%''', escape chance is '''30%'''.

Taux de rencontre |- | [[File:Nidoran(F).png|40px]] Nidoran(F)|| 9.04% |- | [[File:Nidorina.png|40px]] Nidorina || 6.02% |- | [[File:Nidoran(M).png|40px]] Nidoran(M) || 15.06% |- | [[File:Nidorino.png|40px]] Nidorino || 6.02% |- | [[File:Exeggcute.png|40px]] Noeunoeuf || 12.05% |- | [[File:Paras.png|40px]] Paras || 3.01% |- | [[File:Parasect.png|40px]] Parasect || 9.04% |- | [[File:Rhyhorn.png|40px]] Rhin..."

Les Pokémons non-attrapés ont deux fois plus de chances d'apparaitre qu'à la normal. Le joueur peut sortir et entrer du Parc Safari à volonté sans devoir payer les 100 {{Questpoints}} à chaque fois. No other effects. |- | Bait ([[Razz]] [[Berry]]) || Gives the Pokémon "eating" status for 2 - 8 turns. Boosts catch chance by 1.5x for the rest of the encounter unless another type of bait is used. |}

Escape chance quartered: 30 / 4 = '''7.5%'''. * A few turns pass, and Parasect finishes eating. Eating bonuses are reverted, but Nanab bonus persists. revision.text:
{{Infobox battle item |name = Parc Safari |image = [[File:safarizone1.png]] |caption = Le joueur dans le Parc Safari. |location = Kanto }}
The '''Safari Zone''' is an area in [[Kanto]] where the player may spend 100 [[Quest Points]] to try and catch unique [[Kanto]] Pokémon. Some Pokémon, like in the original games, only appear in the Safari Zone. The player receives 30 Safari balls. They have an option to either catch, throw a rock, bait the Pokémon, or flee. To unlock this area the Player must first have the [[Safari Ticket]]. Uncaught Pokémon have double the chance of appearing.
The player may exit and reenter the safari zone without paying the 100 Quest Point fee again provided they still have Safari balls. They only need to pay the fee if they run out of Safari balls and need to reenter to get more.
==Pokémon== {| class="wikitable sortable" style |- ! Pokémon !! Encounter Chance |- | [[File:Nidoran(F).png|40px]] Nidoran(F)|| 9.04% |- | [[File:Nidorina.png|40px]] Nidorina || 6.02% |- | [[File:Nidoran(M).png|40px]] Nidoran(M) || 15.06% |- | [[File:Nidorino.png|40px]] Nidorino || 6.02% |- | [[File:Exeggcute.png|40px]] Exeggcute || 12.05% |- | [[File:Paras.png|40px]] Paras || 3.01% |- | [[File:Parasect.png|40px]] Parasect || 9.04% |- | [[File:Rhyhorn.png|40px]] Rhyhorn || 6.02% |- | [[File:Chansey.png|40px]] Chansey || 2.41% |- | [[File:Scyther.png|40px]] Scyther || 2.41% |- | [[File:Pinsir.png|40px]] Pinsir || 2.41% |- | [[File:Kangaskhan.png|40px]] Kangaskhan || 9.04% |- | [[File:Tauros.png|40px]] Tauros || 6.02% |- | [[File:Cubone.png|40px]] Cubone || 6.02% |- | [[File:Marowak.png|40px]] Marowak || 3.01% |- | [[File:Tangela.png|40px]] Tangela|| 2.41% |}
==Actions== {| class="wikitable" ! Action !! Effect |- | Ball || Attempt to catch the Pokémon with a Safari Ball. Based on catch chance, this action may fail, after which the Pokémon might flee (based on escape chance), watch carefully / be angry (i.e. do nothing), or resume eating bait. Upon running out of Safari Balls, the player will be forced out of the Safari Zone, requiring them to pay the entrance fee again to re-enter. |- | Rock || Toss a rock at the Pokémon, removing "eating" status and making it angry for 2 - 7 turns. When angry, a Pokémon's catch chance and escape chance are both doubled. |- | Run || Flee the encounter and return to the Safari Zone overworld without penalty. |- | colspan=2 | All three types of bait give the Pokémon "eating" status, and removes "angry" status. While eating, a Pokémon's catch chance is halved, and its escape chance is quartered. Pokémon begin encounters with an escape chance of 30%. |- | Bait (generic) || Gives the Pokémon "eating" status for 2 - 7 turns. No other effects. |- | Bait ([[Razz]] [[Berry]]) || Gives the Pokémon "eating" status for 2 - 8 turns. Divides escape chance by 1.5 for the rest of the encounter unless another type of bait is used. |- | Bait ([[Nanab]] [[Berry]]) || Gives the Pokémon "eating" status for 2 - 8 turns. Boosts catch chance by 1.5x for the rest of the encounter unless another type of bait is used. |}
Bait usage example * Parasect encountered in the Safari Zone. Catch chance is '''12.5%''', escape chance is '''30%'''. * Player's turn, Nanab Berry bait used. Catch chance boosted by 1.5x: 12.5 * 1.5 = '''18.75%'''. Escape chance is '''30%'''. * Parasect is eating. Catch chance halved: 18.75 / 2 = '''9.375%'''. Escape chance quartered: 30 / 4 = '''7.5%'''. * A few turns pass, and Parasect finishes eating. Eating bonuses are reverted, but Nanab bonus persists. Catch chance is '''18.75%''', escape chance is '''30%'''.
revision.comment: Created page with "{{Infobox battle item |name = Parc Safari |image = [[File:safarizone1.png]] |caption = Le joueur dans le Parc Safari. |location = Kanto }}"

revision.text:
{{Infobox battle item |name = Safari Zone |image = [[File:safarizone1.png]] |caption = Player in the Safari Zone. |location = Kanto }}
The '''Safari Zone''' is an area in [[Kanto]] where the player may spend 100 [[Quest Points]] to try and catch unique [[Kanto]] Pokémon. Some Pokémon, like in the original games, only appear in the Safari Zone. The player receives 30 Safari balls. They have an option to either catch, throw a rock, bait the Pokémon, or flee. To unlock this area the Player must first have the [[Safari Ticket]]. Uncaught Pokémon have double the chance of appearing.
The player may exit and reenter the safari zone without paying the 100 Quest Point fee again provided they still have Safari balls. They only need to pay the fee if they run out of Safari balls and need to reenter to get more.

Upon running out of Safari Balls, the player will be forced out of the Safari Zone, requiring them to pay the entrance fee again to re-enter. |- | Rock || Toss a rock at the Pokémon, removing "eating" status and making it angry for 2 - 7 turns. While eating, a Pokémon's catch chance is halved, and its escape chance is quartered. Pokémon begin encounters with an escape chance of 30%. |- | Bait (generic) || Gives the Pokémon "eating" status for 2 - 7 turns. No other effects. |- | Bait ([[Razz]] [[Berry]]) || Gives the Pokémon "eating" status for 2 - 8 turns. Divides escape chance by 1.5 for the rest of the encounter unless another type of bait is used. |- | Bait ([[Nanab]] [[Berry]]) || Gives the Pokémon "eating" status for 2 - 8 turns. Boosts catch chance by 1.5x for the rest of the encounter unless another type of bait is used. |}
Bait usage example * Parasect encountered in the Safari Zone. Catch chance is '''12.5%''', escape chance is '''30%'''. * Player's turn, Nanab Berry bait used. Catch chance boosted by 1.5x: 12.5 * 1.5 = '''18.75%'''. Escape chance is '''30%'''. * Parasect is eating. Catch chance halved: 18.75 / 2 = '''9.375%'''. Escape chance quartered: 30 / 4 = '''7.5%'''. * A few turns pass, and Parasect finishes eating. Eating bonuses are reverted, but Nanab bonus persists. Catch chance is '''18.75%''', escape chance is '''30%'''.
